result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants Huber or Huber homemaker.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must report to probation by 3:00 PM on Friday, November 20, 2015.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Must be completed by 5/18/16 or must report to the jail for 10 days.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Count 1. 
Community service and jail condition only apply to count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa M Olson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lisa M Olson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Raymond relates joint agreement.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant pleads Guilty on Count 1 and Count 2.  Court accepts and finds Guilty on Count 1 and Count 2.
State relates recommendation.
Attorney Raymond relates recommendation.
Defendant addresses Court.
  
Court relates and orders:  Imposed & Stayed Sentence.
Count 1:
Jail 6 months with huber or homemaker - Stayed - credit of 5 days if revoked.
Probation: 2 years.
Must complete 75 hours Community Service to be completed by 05-18-2016 or must report to Jail for 10 days.   
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
DNA Sample & Surcharge
Court Costs.  

Count 2:
Jail 6 months with huber - consecutive to Count 1 - Stayed.
Probation concurrent with Count 1 except for community service/10 days in jail.
DNA Sample & Surcharge.
Court Costs.

Report to Community Service today.
Report to Probation by 3:00 p.m. 11-20-2015.
Report to jail for DNA sample Thursday 11-19-2015 between 1:00-5:00 p.m.
Defendant Lisa M Olson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Lisa M Olson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reset.
Bond to continue  Plea hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Lisa M Olson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Lisa M Olson in custody.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State indicates it will be filing an information with misdemeanor charges to which Defendant will plead. For purposes of today, Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts Defendant's waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
